text: UNITED									A
NATIONS
General Assembly
Distr.
GENERAL
14 November 1997
Fifty-second session
Agenda item 157
RESOLUTION ADOPTED BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/52/L.17)]
52/12.	Renewing the United Nations: a programme for reform
The General Assembly,

Affirming its determination to strengthen the role, capacity, effectiveness and efficiency of the United Nations and thus improve its performance in order to realize the full potential of the Organization, in accordance with the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations, and to respond more effectively to the needs and aspirations of the Member States,
textWithHighlights: *Affirming* its determination to strengthen the role, capacity, effectiveness and efficiency of the {{United Nations}} and thus improve its performance in order to realize the full potential of the Organization, in accordance with the purposes and principles of the Charter of the {{United Nations}}, and to respond more effectively to the needs and aspirations of the {{Member States}},
uncertainties: "Affirming" is not in the provided exhaustive list of operative verbs; treated as a reinforcing preambular verb with normalized/action type left null for the verb and set to reinforcing for type. No assignees or deliverables are present.

text: Welcoming the report of the Secretary-General of 14 July 1997 entitled "Renewing the United Nations:  a programme for reform",
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* the report of the {{Secretary-General}} of 14 July 1997 entitled "Renewing the United Nations:  a programme for reform",

text: Having considered the actions described in the report of the Secretary-General entitled "Renewing the United Nations:  a programme for reform" and the addenda thereto, with the clarifications to that report, as well as the statement by the Secretary-General in the open-ended informal consultations of the plenary on 4 November 1997,
textWithHighlights: *Having considered* the actions described in the report of the {{Secretary-General}} entitled "Renewing the United Nations:  a programme for reform" and the addenda thereto, with the clarifications to that report, as well as the statement by the {{Secretary-General}} in the open-ended informal consultations of the plenary on 4 November 1997,

text: Bearing in mind the rules of procedure of the General Assembly and the Financial Regulations and Rules of the Organization,
textWithHighlights: *Bearing in mind* the rules of procedure of the {{General Assembly}} and the Financial Regulations and Rules of the {{Organization}},

text: Commends the efforts and initiatives of the Secretary-General aimed at reforming the United Nations;
textWithHighlights: *Commends* the efforts and initiatives of the {{Secretary-General}} aimed at reforming the {{United Nations}};

text: Calls upon the Secretary-General, while implementing the actions described in his report, to take full account of the views and comments expressed by Member States and groups of Member States, including those transmitted in their communications;
textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* the <<Secretary-General>>, while implementing the actions described in his report, to take full account of the views and comments expressed by {{Member States}} and groups of {{Member States}}, including those transmitted in their communications;

text: Stresses that the actions will be implemented with full respect for the relevant mandates, decisions and resolutions of the General Assembly, including in particular the medium-term plan for the period 1998-2001;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* that the actions will be implemented with full respect for the relevant mandates, decisions and resolutions of the {{General Assembly}}, including in particular the medium-term plan for the period 1998-2001;

text: Notes that the report of the Secretary-General of 11 September 1997 will be considered in the context of the examination of the proposed programme budget for the biennium 1998-1999;
textWithHighlights: *Notes* that the report of the {{Secretary-General}} of 11 September 1997 will be considered in the context of the examination of the proposed programme budget for the biennium 1998-1999;

text: Affirms that programmatic implications of relevant actions will be considered in conjunction with related recommendations;
textWithHighlights: *Affirms* that programmatic implications of relevant actions will be considered in conjunction with related recommendations;
uncertainties: The operative verb 'affirms' is not included in the provided exhaustive list; treated here as a reinforcing verb. No explicit assignee or concrete deliverable is specified.

text: Requests the Secretary-General to submit a report on the implementation of the actions described in his report entitled "Renewing the United Nations:  a programme for reform" to the General Assembly at its fifty-third session;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Report on implementation of reform actions

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to submit a [[report]] on the implementation of the actions described in his report entitled "Renewing the United Nations:  a programme for reform" to the {{General Assembly}} at its fifty-third session;

text: Decides to continue its consideration of the report of the Secretary-General entitled "Renewing the United Nations:  a programme for reform".
textWithHighlights: *Decides* to continue its [[consideration]] of the report of the {{Secretary-General}} entitled "Renewing the United Nations:  a programme for reform".
uncertainties: Mapped 'consideration' to the deliverable type 'review'; this seems the closest category for continuing consideration of a report.

text: 49th plenary meeting
12 November 1997
